My final advice is wizard of oz: do everything with service and compassion, excellence, and moral courage. Speak truth to power.  Mr. Low
My final advice is for you to align your value with your carreer so that all your failures will be part of your journey. Ms. Gamez
We need to understand our students otherwise we will just be impementing things we think they want but it wont affect behavioral change Vic
It is very exciting to say "we are going to save the world" but we had to focus to be sustainable. Victoria Gamez #GPPN2012
The clever policy entepreneur will make use of the bureaucratic slack to effect change -Donald Low #GPPN2012
The belief is that meritocracy is the main driver of equality. But for Sg as long as you have social mobikity there will be equality Mr. Low
Think of yourselves as policy entepreneurs. Your job i to truly understand the problem and come up with the best solution. Donald Low #GPPN
But how to we transform policy to action? Dr. Phua #GPPN2012
Economists overestimate the power of incentives #donaldlow #gppn2012
Once you crowd out social norms with market normsit is diff to go back to the status quo #donaldlow
Market norms and incentives are not value neutral; incentivizing by cash corrodes the value of certain things (like education) -Donald Low
Work is not just for income but also for social cohesion; people feel part of society when they earn. -Donald Low #GPPN2012
Traditional economics wil treat inequality by taxing and transferring while behavioral economics will incude desirable social norms -Mr. Low
Change happens in "salami slices" -Donald Low #GPPN2012
Because accdg to the market, competition is good and inequality is normal -Donald Low #GPPN2012
When a society is so driven by market norms, it becomes a harsher society. -Donal Low #Gppn2012
There are no explicit restrictions on media but there are passed down norms (Donald Low on the questin re free media in Singapore) #GPPN2012
I do not believe in charity; you end up spoiling our beneficiaries. It has to be a collaborative effort. -Victoria Games
In Aidha we try to bring the professionals closer to the migrant workers; they serve as mentors to our students. -Victoria Gamez #GPPN2012
We had to understand the concerns that our students. What is reality for them? -Victoria Gamez #GPPN2012
Aidha's theory of change: from diagnosing the problem to the intervention that we do so as to lessen the inequality that we encounter.
After identifyng the social issue that exist, understanding how to resolve it is veryimportant. That is why we do research. -Victoria Gamez
As a non-profit, we had to first recognize that there is an issue with the migrants in Singapore -Victoria Gamez #GPPN2012
Ms.Victoria Gamez talks about her experience of migration economics #GPPN2012
3 pts: Think hard of reforming institutions, what city govts can do, reposition economics -Donald Low #GPPN2012
There should be a rethink of how we do economics -Donald Low #GPPN2012
The failure of governance: tackling collective problems. We need to reform institutins -Donald Low #GPPN2012

Question from the audience: How do we define boundaries of the state? #GPPN2012

The rise of Asia is not a revenge against the West. If it becomes a revenge, it will make things bad for all of us. #GPPN2012
